Dear Mr. Genwright:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
7/12/22-7/13/22. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the MSA and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of inspection
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.10103 Program statement.
(1) A facility shall have a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Written policies and procedures pertaining to the
admission, care, and release of residents.
I reviewed 12 incident reports. The incident reports did not
contain the needed information outlined in their “Written
Documentation” policy. The incidents resulted in the usage of
the seclusion room. Because the incident reports were vague, it
appeared the staff were using seclusion as a “first response” to
behavioral issues ranging from disrespect to aggressive
behavior. After interviews, it was clear the staff are using their
de-escalation techniques outlined in their behavior management
plan, they are just not documenting this information. One of the
incident reports resulted in a restraint. As written, the agency
would be in violation of using an improper restraint. After
discussions, it was once again perceived that the staff and
supervisor did not include all of the information required in their
incident report policy to outline the events leading up to the
restraint.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R 400.10103: Incident report writing
R 400.10208: Preliminary resident plan: Specific needs has been added to the
report. A child had a specific medical need (insulin shots and monitoring). The
agency has a good process to ensure that all staff are aware of the needs. This
information is kept in a medical record and dispersed from the nurse to the
supervisors to the staff. Through interviews it was clear that the process works
well. Although they have a different system to outline medical needs (in the
4

medical files) It was discussed to add those medical needs to the Preliminary
resident report under “residents immediate and specific needs”.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas: CAP writing.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
Interim CAP 2021: The agency was cited during the 2020 interim for failure to
have all the required parts to their preliminary assessment. The required parts
were added as observed by this consultant during this renewal evaluation.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
